title: Bread Butter and Jam Recipe, Finger Food Ideas for Babies
content:
This is a recipe that is not even a recipe, but I just want to share it with you all because it makes great finger food for babies and this is just to give you an idea. So try this out, and this is not only for babies, it makes a great breakfast for adults as well.

 

Preparation Time: 5 mins

Makes: 1 sandwich

 

Ingredients:

Bread as needed

Butter as needed

Jam as needed

 

Method:

Take a bread slice, spread butter generously over it, then spread jam over it. Sandwich it together.

Cut the edges, then cut into slices or strips.

Use a squeezy bottle to make designs over the sandwich.

recommendations.content: I have never heard about this milkshake until my sister mentioned this. She told me that she feeds her baby this milkshake and it tastes really yummy too. recommendations.title: Keerai Dosa Recipe, Spinach Dosa for babies, Toddlers & Kids
recommendations.content:
Healthy spinach dosa which tastes so yummy and is so nutritious for your baby. This dosa is a green color with tons of health benefits in them.
This is an easy way to include spinach in your toddler or kid's diet. They will never find it and still, they will enjoy eating green dosa.

recommendations.title: Beetroot milk Recipe, Rose milk using Beetroots
recommendations.content:
Delicious rose milk made using beetroots. This is healthy for kids and toddlers. Instead of giving normal rose milk with lots of food coloring, you can give this beet milk.
